sanskrit_verse:
अनिन्दितैः स्त्रीविवाहैरनिन्द्या भवति प्रजा ।
निन्दितैर्निन्दिता नॄणां तस्मान्निन्द्यान् विवर्जयेत् ॥ ३.४२॥
transliteration:
aninditaiḥ strīvivāhair anindyā bhavati prajā |
ninditair ninditā nṝṇāṃ tasmān nindyān vivarjayet || 3.42||
sph_interpretive_translation: When unions occur with women who are free from blame, the progeny becomes pure; when unions occur with blameworthy persons, the offspring bear that blemish—therefore, one must avoid all blameworthy connections.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates in purity of lineage and union
Causation flows through conscious selection and relational integrity
Capacity-based responsibility includes the duty to preserve generational sanctity
Restoration logic requires severance from corrupting influences
Consciousness alignment necessitates rejection of associations that degrade dharmic potential
executable_legal_axioms: IF a union involves a person marked by societal or karmic impurity THEN disallow continuation of such lineage-forming bonds
IF an individual knowingly enters a contaminated relational field THEN restrict their eligibility for custodial or procreative roles
IF evidence shows degradation in familial or social conduct due to prior association THEN initiate separation protocol without punitive intent
IF a citizen demonstrates repeated disregard for dharmic relational standards THEN realign access to reproductive or leadership capacities
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving family law, inheritance rights, or guardianship, the Supreme Court shall assess relational integrity as foundational to legal capacity. Where contamination arises from improper unions, judicial action must focus on restoring purity of lineage rather than imposing punitive sanctions.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Truth-discernment (Pramāṇa) reveals that character defects manifest sequentially (Anupūrvaśaḥ) through relational choices. Responsibility aligns proportionally with awareness of harm caused—not through infliction of pain, but through withdrawal of participation in further distortion.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Facilitate acknowledgment and cessation of harmful relational patterns
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Guide individuals toward recognizing consequences of degraded unions
Capacity Restoration: Realign reproductive and custodial functions according to dharmic fitness
Integrity Reintegration: Support re-entry into lawful society upon demonstrated purification
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma stands restored through conscious alignment. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
